prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in elementary school would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in elementary school would. Simplify $(2x - 5)(x + 7) - (x + 5)(2x - 1)$.
gpt_response:
First, you distribute the numbers inside the parentheses. So, for $(2x - 5)(x + 7)$, you would multiply $2x$ by $x$ and $-5$ by $x$ and $2x$ by $7$ and $-5$ by $7$. Then do the same for $(x + 5)(2x - 1)$. Next, you subtract the second set of parentheses from the first set of parentheses by just subtracting each term from each other. Let me do the math: 

$$(2x - 5)(x + 7) - (x + 5)(2x - 1)$$
$$= 2x \cdot x + 2x \cdot 7 - 5 \cdot x - 5 \cdot 7 - x \cdot 2x - x \cdot (-1) - 5 \cdot 2x - 5 \cdot (-1)$$
$$= 2x^2 + 14x - 5x - 35 - 2x^2 + x - 10x + 5$$
$$= 2x - 30$$

So, the answer simplified is $2x - 30$.
solution_prompt:
Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following equal to -30?: First, you distribute the numbers inside the parentheses. So, for $(2x - 5)(x + 7)$, you would multiply $2x$ by $x$ and $-5$ by $x$ and $2x$ by $7$ and $-5$ by $7$. Then do the same for $(x + 5)(2x - 1)$. Next, you subtract the second set of parentheses from the first set of parentheses by just subtracting each term from each other. Let me do the math: 

$$(2x - 5)(x + 7) - (x + 5)(2x - 1)$$
$$= 2x \cdot x + 2x \cdot 7 - 5 \cdot x - 5 \cdot 7 - x \cdot 2x - x \cdot (-1) - 5 \cdot 2x - 5 \cdot (-1)$$
$$= 2x^2 + 14x - 5x - 35 - 2x^2 + x - 10x + 5$$
$$= 2x - 30$$

So, the answer simplified is $2x - 30$.
